wikipedia_page.main:
Benjamin Hall (6 March 1879 – 1963) was an English football player, manager and trainer, who played as a centre half.
Hall's playing career saw him represent Grimsby Town, Derby County, Leicester Fosse, Hyde, Heywood United and South Shields before the First World War. After the war he worked as a trainer for Huddersfield Town before being appointed as Bristol Rovers' first Football League manager in 1920.Three of his brothers, Harry, Ellis and Fretwell, also played in the Football League.
